sentences.en: A dodge behind a tree kept her from being run over.
sentences.cn: 她向树后一闪,才没被车从身上辗过.

sentences.en: Dodge is waiting to have a word with you.
Face your problem boldly instead of trying to dodge them.
sentences.cn: 要勇敢地面对你的问题,不要躲避它们.

sentences.en: He is able to dodge out of the way.
He made a sudden dodge aside.
He ran across the courtyard, dodging a storm of bullets.
sentences.cn: 他跑过院子，躲避雨点般的子弹。

sentences.en: He tried to dodge the reporters'queries.
sentences.cn: 他试图躲闪记者的询问.

sentences.en: Of course, if they pull the same dodge again, that's something else.
sentences.cn: 当然, 如果他们再用同样的诡计, 那就又当别论.

sentences.en: She was sharp - witted enough to dodge her attacker.
sentences.cn: 她才思敏捷足以避开别人的攻击.

sentences.en: The dodge was coopered by the police.
The said Edmund Dodge was seen breaking into the house.
sentences.cn: 有人看到这个艾德蒙·道奇闯入那间住宅.

sentences.en: The vice president had to dodge flying tomatoes.
sentences.cn: 副总统不得不闪躲飞来的番茄.

sentences.en: They're just working some religious dodge or other, I guess.
sentences.cn: 我看,这些人无非又在搞什么宗教的把戏吧.

sentences.en: This was not just a tax dodge.
To dodge the draft, he tried bribery.
sentences.cn: 为逃避兵役, 他施行贿赂.

sentences.en: Whatever you do, work hard at it and don't try to dodge the column.
sentences.cn: 无论做什么事, 都要努力去做,别偷懒.

words.tran_cn: 狡猾的，逃避的；善于骗人的；躲闪的

trans.tran_cn: 推脱的计策，骗人的伎俩
trans.tran_en: something dishonest that is done to avoid a rule or law
to move quickly to avoid someone or something
to move quickly to avoid someone or something
to deliberately avoid discussing something or doing something
